description: Convencer a los venezolanos―sobre todo a los más jóvenes―de una imagen más suave forma parte de una apuesta por la legitimidad dentro y fuera del país de cara a las presidenciales de julio, sobre todo después de haber incumplido un acuerdo para la celebración de elecciones justas y libres
title: “¿Por qué no me dan likes y retweets?”: Maduro quiere dejar atrás su imagen de déspota

description: The World Bank approved $2.25 billion in funding to support Nigeria’s economic reform efforts and boost the supply of hard currency on the local foreign-exchange market.
title: World Bank Approves $2.25 Billion for Nigeria’s Reform Efforts

description: A top Senate Democrat is reviewing limits put on US weapons sales to Saudi Arabia, signaling warmer ties as the Biden administration pursues a security agreement with the kingdom and seeks to ease the Israel-Hamas conflict.
title: Limits on US Arms Sales to Saudi Arabia Draw Review, Showing Shift

description: Donald Trump told Senate Republicans Thursday he would restart oil drilling in Alaska’s Arctic National Wildlife Refuge, reversing a move by the Biden administration to cancel leases in the frozen wilderness.
title: Trump Says He’ll Restart Oil Drilling in Alaska Wildlife Refuge

description: Reform UK leader Nigel Farage declared his party “the opposition to Labour” after an opinion poll showed it had overtaken the Conservatives for the first time, the latest evidence suggesting Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is heading for a heavy election defeat.
title: Farage’s Reform Overtakes Sunak’s Tories in ‘Crossover’ UK Poll

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, politics editor Laura Davison looks at Donald Trump’s day in the capital where he met with members of Congress and business leaders. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Chief Executives, GOP Leaders Embrace Economic Nostalgia for Trump

description: Two US senators are introducing a bill that would require ride-hailing companies including Uber Technologies Inc. and Lyft Inc. to notify passengers if their assigned drivers are using dashcams to record them.
title: US Lawmakers Take On Uber, Lyft Rider Surveillance in New Bill

description: Convincing Venezuelans—particularly younger ones—of a softer image is part of a bid for legitimacy at home and abroad ahead of the July presidential vote, especially after having violated a deal for fair and free elections
title: ‘Why Don’t You Give Me Likes?’: Maduro Wants to Ditch Despot Image

description: President Javier Milei will walk into a meeting with the head of the International Monetary Fund on Friday emboldened by the most successful series of wins since the libertarian economist took power in Argentina six months ago.
title: Milei Looks to Keep Winning Streak Alive in Crucial IMF Meeting

description: Donald Trump’s proposals to increase tariffs on foreign goods are part of a strategy to raise revenue, his onetime Commerce secretary said, as the former president weighs new levies on US trading partners if he wins the November election.
title: Trump Likes Tariffs as a ‘Revenue Source,’ Wilbur Ross Says

description: Rishi Sunak can’t afford another D-day gaffe.
title: UK’s Sunak Forced to Deny Being Snubbed at G-7 After D-Day Gaffe

description: US Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas failed to disclose at least three more private jet trips across the US paid for by GOP megadonor Harlan Crow, according to documents released by Senate Democrats.
title: Clarence Thomas Took More Trips on Harlan Crow’s Private Jet

description: US President Joe Biden hailed a new security agreement, plans for $50 billion in Ukraine aid and expanded sanctions targeting Moscow as a clear signal to Russian President Vladimir Putin that the US and allies are not “backing down” from their support for Kyiv.
title: Biden Vows Allies Will Stand With Ukraine ‘Until They Prevail’

description: Donald Trump promised to lower the corporate tax rate to 20%, further reducing the income levy on the largest US companies that he already slashed while president, according to people familiar with the remarks.
title: Trump Tells CEOs He Would Cut Corporate Tax Rate to 20%

description: Left-leaning political parties in France sealed an alliance to join forces in the upcoming legislative election, with polls showing it can win the second-biggest bloc behind Marine Le Pen’s National Rally.
title: France’s Left Unites to Challenge Le Pen, Macron for Power

description: Canadian Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre is pledging to review the capital gains tax hike if elected prime minister – but he won’t commit to repealing the measure.
title: Canada’s Poilievre to Review Capital Gains Tax Hike If Elected

description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said she was most concerned about smaller Chinese banks doing business with Russia, even as she didn’t rule out sanctioning a bigger lender if it engaged in “systematic violations” of sanctions against the Kremlin.
title: Yellen Says Big Chinese Banks Are Adhering to Russian Sanctions

description: Talks about forming a new government in South Africa are continuing, the African National Congress said.
title: ANC Says South African Parties Still Discussing Unity Government

description: Labour Leader Keir Starmer set out his party’s plan for government in a cautious pitch focused on growth and security that prioritized preserving a commanding lead in UK polls, while skirting the tough economic choices he’ll have to make if he wins power.
title: Labour’s Cautious Pitch for UK Power Ducks Hard Economic Choices

description: Donald Trump railed against President Joe Biden’s electric vehicle policies in a meeting with House Republicans Thursday and said he would undo them if he takes the White House in November, according to lawmakers who attended the private meeting.
title: Trump Tells GOP He Plans to Entirely Reverse Biden’s EV Policy

description: Donald Trump floated the idea of using tariff hikes as a way to pay for some income tax cuts, a move that would inject uncertainty into global trade and consumer prices as Congress debates a tax code overhaul next year.
title: Trump Floats Tariffs Hikes to Offset Some Income Tax Cuts

description: Ghana sent a new debt restructuring proposal to the country’s international bondholders as it aims to advance talks on reworking $13 billion of Eurobonds, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Ghana Sends New Debt Rework Proposal to Advance Bondholder Talks

description: The White House will nominate Christy Goldsmith Romero to take over as head of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. after a probe found credible allegations of harassment and discrimination at the bank regulator.
title: White House Picks Christy Goldsmith Romero to Lead FDIC

description: A South African government comprising the African National Congress and the Democratic Alliance may prove unstable because of a lack of agreement within the ANC for such a tie-up, S&P Global Ratings said.
title: S&P Skeptical of South African Government Tie-Up Between ANC, DA

description: Consumers are increasingly taking politics into account when making purchasing decisions, according to a new report tracking the corporate impact from wars, divisive elections and other challenges.
title: One in Three Consumers Are Boycotting Brands Over War in Gaza, Global Survey Shows

description: Peru is pitching a new port project to investors in the US, describing it as a potential balance to growing Chinese influence over maritime trade in the South American nation.
title: Using China as a Foil, Peru Pitches New Port to American Investors

description: Kenya announced a 3.3% budget deficit to gross domestic product for the coming fiscal year, slightly higher than the 2.9% it had initially signaled.
title: Kenya Rejigs Budget to Accommodate Slightly Wider Fiscal Deficit

description: South Africa’s National Freedom Party said it has agreed to cooperate with three bigger rivals to form a government in the eastern KwaZulu-Natal province, a deal that would effectively lock out a new party led by former President Jacob Zuma, which won the most support in the region in last month’s elections.
title: Four South African Parties Weigh Tie-Up to Govern KwaZulu-Natal

description: South Africa’s leftist Economic Freedom Fighters party said it would back the election of Cyril Ramaphosa as president in parliament in return for support for the position of speaker of the assembly.
title: South Africa’s EFF Offers to Back Ramaphosa to Get Speaker Post

description: Emmanuel Macron isn’t one for keeping a low profile. Typically, at the Group of Seven meetings, he’s one of the loudest voices in the room. But right now, he’s looking a lot more subdued.
title: What Was Macron Thinking? G-7 Leaders Lament His Risky Bet

description: The Pentagon renewed a contract with Elon Musk’s SpaceX to provide Starlink internet services in Ukraine for another six months, a fresh sign that the two sides have moved past a dispute over how the terminals were being used in the conflict zone.
title: Pentagon Deal With Musk’s Starlink in Ukraine Extended Six Months for $14 Million

description: The US and its allies have found a way to fund Ukraine’s war effort by tapping Russian assets parked in their banking systems. The accord, set to be agreed at the Group of Seven summit in Italy, follows years of wrangling over how to use the Russian funds without engaging in a legally questionable asset grab. Washington pushed initially for an outright seizure to help Ukraine’s fightback and support its shattered economy, but some European leaders were wary this could set a dangerous precedent.
title: Why Using Russian Assets to Fund Ukraine Is Fraught

description: Tanzania’s public debt is well within sustainable metrics despite ballooning by close to a fifth in the year through March, Finance Minister Mwigulu Nchemba said in his budget speech, seeking to allay discontent over the surge in obligations.
title: Tanzania Seeks to Allay Concerns Over $35 Billion Debt in Budget

description: South Africa’s African National Congress confirmed premier candidates in seven of the country’s nine provinces where it got either outright control or the most votes in the May 29 elections, according to a statement.
title: South Africa ANC Confirms Premier Candidates for Seven Provinces

description: India re-appointed Ajit Doval as the National Security Advisor, in yet another move intended to showcase continuity in Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s third term in office.
title: Modi Retains Former Super Spy as India’s National Security Adviser

description: New Yorkers and Californians seeking a big expansion to the state and local tax deduction when Congress debates a renewal of Donald Trump’s tax cuts next year are unlikely to see their wishes granted, President Joe Biden’s top economic adviser said.
title: White House Downplays Hopes for SALT Cap Hike as Tax Fight Looms

description: Chile’s government will pressure Venezuela to step up in the fight against crime as Latin America stares down the threat from international gangs, a senior cabinet member said in an interview.
title: Chile Says Venezuela Is Coming Up Short in Regional Crime Fight

description: Donald Trump’s presidential campaign raised $2.5 million at a London fundraiser, where the candidate was absent, but other allies including British politician Nigel Farage and hedge fund founder Scott Bessent made appearances, according to a person familiar with the event.
title: Farage Attends Trump Event in London That Raised $2.5 Million

description: The US, UK and Canada accused Russia of interfering in Moldova’s presidential election by trying to put a pro-Kremlin candidate in office and block the country’s bid to join the European Union.
title: Russia Draws West’s Warning to Stop Meddling in Moldova Election

description: The Bank of Italy stuck with a pessimistic growth outlook for 2024, cut its projections further in the future, and said the risks lean to the downside.
title: Bank of Italy Growth Outlook Is Downbeat Amid Higher Rate View

description: Norway’s prime minister signaled a hardening stance on China, pledging tighter cooperation with businesses on security risks linked to the Asian nation.
title: Norway’s Leader Ratchets Up Warnings on Chinese Threats

description: French President Emmanuel Macron’s approval rating fell to its lowest level in 5 1/2 years, according to a poll carried out after he called a snap vote in response to defeat in European elections.
title: Macron’s Approval Falls to the Lowest Level Since Late 2018

description: Keir Starmer’s Labour manifesto committed to tripling solar power capacity by the end of the next parliament, but that may not be enough to reach the already challenging climate goal of net zero by 2050.
title: Labour’s Solar Power Plan May Fall Short of Key Climate Goal

description: The Russian Prosecutor General’s office formally sent the case of imprisoned Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich to court, accusing him of spying “on instructions from the CIA.”
title: Russia Sends WSJ Reporter’s Case to Court, Accuses Him of Spying

description: Finland will offer vaccines to citizens, including poultry-farm workers and veterinarians, who are at risk from avian influenza, as the virus spreads across the world.
title: Finland Offers Bird Flu Vaccines to Citizens Exposed to Poultry

description: A cargo ship was on fire after being hit by two unknown projectiles while sailing in the Gulf of Aden, the UK Navy said, marking the second significant attack in the area in as many days.
title: Ship on Fire Near Yemen After Second Attack in as Many Days

description: After 18 months walking a delicate tightrope between a president who wants to spend and investors demanding fiscal discipline, Brazil’s Finance Minister Fernando Haddad is starting to lose his balance.
title: Brazil Finance Chief’s Star Fades as He Faces Worst Moment of Tenure

description: The UK announced wide-ranging sanctions on Russia, including a first attempt to clamp down on a shadow-fleet of tankers transporting the Kremlin’s oil and a key Moscow-based insurance company.
title: UK Imposes First Sanctions on Russia’s Shadow Fleet Oil Tankers

description: The German finance ministry is considering a supplementary budget for this year with additional borrowing of as much as €11 billion ($11.9 billion), according to people familiar with the discussions.
title: Germany Considers Extra 2024 Budget to Plug €11 Billion Gap

description: Labour Leader Keir Starmer set out his party’s plan for government focused on economic growth and security, a crunch moment for Britain’s would-be prime minister ahead of the general election on July 4.
title: Starmer Sets Out Labour’s Growth Plan in Key UK Election Moment

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government and his provincial counterparts must be “laser-focused” on growing the productive capacity of Canada’s economy or risk falling further behind other nations, says a new report co-authored by former Bank of Canada Governor David Dodge.
title: Canada Needs ‘Laser-Focused’ Productivity Strategy, Dodge Says

description: Since the early days of Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine, about $300 billion of his central bank’s money has been earning income in accounts in places like Belgium.
title: How the US and Europe Argued Their Way to a Russian Assets Deal

description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said he may not remain in his post after the snap legislative elections that have plunged the country into political uncertainty over the next government.
title: France’s Finance Chief Hints at Different Future After Election

description: With Labour set to reveal its manifesto of election promises on Thursday, Keir Starmer’s opposition party is sitting on a large lead in national polling that shows little sign of ebbing halfway through the campaign.
title: Labour Has Big Lead on Manifesto Day,  Poll of Polls Shows

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Bruised G-7 Leaders Strive to Prove They Count

description: The European Union should take measures to deal with Chinese overcapacity in other industries after deciding to impose tariffs on imports of electric vehicles from China, French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said.
title: Le Maire Urges Tariffs in Other Areas After EU Acts on China EVs

description: Donald Trump’s brand on Wall Street, once tarnished by the US Capitol attack and his bombastic political rhetoric, has made a near-full recovery, evidenced by the lineup of bank industry chieftains attending an event with the former president.
title: Trump to Pitch Dimon, Fraser as Verdict Fails to Scare Off CEOs

description: Group of Seven nations have agreed on a loan structure based on the size of their economies to provide Ukraine with about $50 billion of fresh aid starting to flow by the end of the year, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: G-7 Agree How to Tap Frozen Russian Assets for $50B to Ukraine

description: South Africa’s biggest political rivals are close to clinching a deal to form a new government on the eve of the election of the nation’s president.
title: South Africa Edges Closer to New Government on Eve of Key Vote
Live: G-7 Leaders Converge in Italy on Day One of Summit

description: At his Wednesday press conference, Emmanuel Macron brandished the prospect of economic Armageddon should the far-right end up in government, calling on voters to not succumb to the “fever of the extremes.” Trouble is, that time-honored strategy has proved to be increasingly ineffective.
title: Macron’s Dire Warnings About Le Pen May Not Work This Time

description: New Zealand and China pledged to strengthen their economic ties even as they acknowledged disagreements during the first day of Chinese Premier Li Qiang’s visit to the South Pacific nation.
title: China Seeks Stronger Ties With New Zealand as Premier Li Visits

description: China’s foreign ministry has issued a travel alert for Palau, days after the tiny Pacific archipelago accused Beijing of being involved in a cyberattack in which more than 20,000 government documents were reportedly stolen.
title: China Issues Travel Warning for Palau Following Hack Accusation

description: “Such steps will ultimately harm us all,” academy president says.
title: Israeli Scientists Are Shunned by Universities Over the Gaza War

description: Revelations of the leader’s disdain for civilian life should surprise no one.
title: Hamas and Netanyahu Both Have to Lose in Gaza

description: As the US and its allies seek to regroup on Ukraine aid, new alliances stoked by China and Russia are flexing their rising clout.
title: How G-7 Nations Hope to Counter Russia and China’s Axis of Resistance

description: A division of the World Bank argued it shouldn’t compensate teachers and students who were exploited or faced unsafe conditions at a chain of schools in Kenya that received funding from the lender, in defiance of a recommendation from the bank’s own watchdog.
title: World Bank Unit Argues Against Compensation in Kenya Abuse Cases

description: Imports at the Port of Los Angeles remained above the pre-pandemic peak in the first five months of 2024 despite ticking down in May compared to a year before.
title: Port of Los Angeles Imports Fell 4.5% in May, Exports Rose 23.8%
